titleStmt.title: Here begynneth a godly new story of .xii. men that moyses (by the co[m]maundement of god) sent to spye owt the land of canaan of whiche .xii. onely Iosua and Caleb, wer found faythful messengers.
titleStmt.author: Nicolls, Philip.

publicationStmt.publisher: The tenth daye of Maye: anno dominice incarnationis M C XLViii. By William Hill remayning at the signe of the hill in Paules Churche yarde: and be there by him to be solde,

notesStmt.note: "The epistle to the reader" signed: Phillyp Nicolls.
Imprint from colophon; correct publication date from STC.
In the imprint, the first "n" in "incarnationis" is printed upside down.
Running title reads: The story of .xii. men.
The "C" in the date has been altered to a "D".
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: the signe of the hill in Paules Churche yarde:
